com.versant
Class DefineClass

java.lang.Object
  com.versant.DefineClass

public class DefineClass
extends java.lang.Object

The DefineClass utility defines the schema for the users persistent classes in the database. If schema for the class already exists in the database, but is outdated, this utility can be used to evolve the existing schema or to drop the existing class definition and to redefine the class.

DefineClass Syntax

java com.versant.DefineClass <options> -db <database Name> arguments

DefineClass Arguments

DefineClass uses a list of classes and/or file names to define the schema for classes in the database. If the class name is specified the name of the class has to be fully qualified:

    java com.versant.DefineClass com.mycorp.Employee
When class files are not specified, the arguments to the utility can either be a directory or a jar file. If the file specified is a directory file then the directory will be searched recursively for class files which will then be used to define the schema in the database. If the file specified is a jar file then the classes in the jar file will be used to define the schema.

DefineClass database name

-db database name : The database to be used for schema definition.

DefineClass Options

  • -evolve: This option will cause existing schema for a class to be evolved if it is not in sync with the current class definition. This option cannot be used along with the redefine option. The two options are mutually exclusive.
  • -redefine: When this option is used and the schema in the database for a persistent class is outdated, the utility will drop the class and all of its instances and redefine the class in the database.
  • -noprompt: When this option is turned on, the user will not have a chance of reviewing the changes DefineClass intends to make to the database schema.
